required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Influence of Neuromuscular Reversal on Neurological Physical Exam Time in Lumbar Neurosurgical Cases.
clinical_study.official_title: The Influence of Neuromuscular Reversal With Neostigmine or Sugammadex on Neurological Physical Exam Time in Lumbar Neurosurgical Cases.

brief_summary.textblock: Neurological physical exam is a very important outcome that should be evaluated as soon as possible after every lumbar procedures. The aim of this study was to evaluate the neurological physical examination time after lumbar procedures.

detailed_description.textblock: Neurological physical exam is a very important outcome that should be evaluated as soon as possible after every lumbar procedures. By that early postoperative neurological complications can be revealed and early interventions planned. The aim of this study was to evaluate the neurological physical examination time after lumbar procedures. Two routinely used different reversal agents (neostigmine or sugammadex) were compared according reversal times and muscle strength on PACU admission.

secondary_outcome.description: Muscle strength at PACU transfer (evaluated with a 5 point scale) 0/5: no contraction in muscles 1/5: muscle flicker but no movement 2/5: movement possible bÄ±t not against gravity (test the joint in its horizontal plane) 3/5: moment possible against gravity but not against resistance by the examiner 4/5: movement possible against resistance by the examiner 5/5: normal strength

arm_group.description: Group S: Group sugammadex Patients in this group received sugammadex at the end of the surgery, as neuromuscular reversal agent. Neurological physical exam time was recorded.
Group N: Group Neostigmine Patients in this group received neostigmine at the end of the surgeryas neuromuscular reversal agent. Neurological physical exam time was recorded.

intervention.description: Neurological physical exam is performed in all patients at the OR table, immediately after the operation.

study_pop.textblock: All lumbar surgeries performed during the study period were enrolled in the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Lumber surgery
- ASA I-II
- Elective surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Emergency cases
- Age lower than 18
- Age higher than 65
- Patient with existing neurological deficit
- Patient with existing renal insufficiency
